document_data.name: Julkoun
document_data.caption: Map of Julkoun and surrounding area, circa the 1480s DR.
document_data.mainbody: '''Julkoun''' was a hamlet on the [[Delimbiyr]] halfway between [[Daggerford]] and [[Secomber]].
document_data.Description: The pastoral hamlet was home to about forty households of stout farmers. The hamlet was filled with small gardens surrounded by low stone walls and hedgerows. The streets were grassy and often filled with grazing [[goat]]s and [[sheep]].
document_data.Geography: The hamlet was located along the banks of the [[Delimbiyr River]], upstream from [[Laughing Hollow]].
document_data.History: The village was originally the hamlet of '''Shining''' until [[Julkoun (person)|Julkoun]] built a large stone mill and shrine to [[Chauntea]] in [[1287 DR]].
